description: Retrieves properties for an alias. This operation returns all alias metadata and settings. To get an alias's target fleet ID only, use ResolveAlias. To get alias properties, specify the alias ID. If successful, the requested alias record is returned. All APIs by task.

parameters.name: AliasId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the fleet alias that you want to retrieve. You can use either the alias ID or ARN value.

nested_items.name: AliasId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the alias. Alias IDs are unique within a Region.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A descriptive label that is associated with an alias. Alias names do not need to be unique.

nested_items.name: AliasArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name ( ARN) that is assigned to a Amazon GameLift alias resource and uniquely identifies it. ARNs are unique across all Regions. Format is arn:aws:gamelift:<region>::alias/alias-a1234567-b8c9-0d1e-2fa3-b45c6d7e8912. In a GameLift alias ARN, the resource ID matches the alias ID value.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A human-readable description of an alias.

nested_items.name: RoutingStrategy
nested_items.description: The routing configuration, including routing type and fleet target, for the alias.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of routing strategy for the alias.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the fleet that the alias points to. This value is the fleet ID, not the fleet ARN.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The message text to be used with a terminal routing strategy.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A time stamp indicating when this data object was created. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTime
nested_items.description: The time that this data object was last modified. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").
